items.subject: Ari - Project Idea
items.snippet: Happy New Year to all ü•ÇüçæüçÑ Here is a description of a possible project that CHAMP can take on.  This is just an outline. It does not include technicalities. I can provide the technical methodol
items.htmlBody:
Happy New Year to all ü•ÇüçæüçÑ
Here is a description of a possible project that CHAMP can take on. 
This is just an outline. It does not include technicalities. I can provide the technical methodology if a consensus is reached. 
The project entails placing a network of synchronized (programmable) LED lights under the surface of water. For example, ‚ÄúDuckpond‚Äù, at Boston Public Garden, this is where the Swan boats are. In the winter the pond is un-utilized. Procedurally, the LED-network will be installed in the pond before it freezes. When the pond does eventually freeze over, it will create the proper conditions to deliver an immersive, colorful light show, with images that appear emanating through the ice. The subject matter can widely vary, and include fungi with associated culturally-themed characters. This can also be set to sound affects. Funding for the project can be through the Mass Cultural Council. Or, directly from the city of Boston Art Commission.

                         Ari 

                Ari Stamatiou 
         Plimira@comcast.net
                617-962-8550

items.subject: [CHAMP: News] C.H.A.M.P.‚Äôs Weekend Update; Forecasting Next Events
items.snippet: R eport from C.H.A.M.P.‚Äôs 1st Foray, Lincoln, MA 12.7.25 Larry started off saying something about the importance of noticing what we don‚Äôt see, but the presence of negative data couldn‚Äôt hold a candle
items.htmlBody:
Report from C.H.A.M.P.‚Äôs 1st Foray, Lincoln, MA 12.7.25

Larry started off saying something about the importance of noticing what we don‚Äôt see, but the presence of negative data couldn‚Äôt hold a candle to what materialized 10 minutes later: Bulgaria inquinans, commonly called Black Bulgar or Bachelor‚Äôs Buttons ‚Äì bulbous protrusions like gobs of tar emerging from huge sawn logs ‚Äì oak, I believe. Matte black, like Finnish licorice, with cup-like depressions. I mistakenly thought the name had something to do with the former Soviet country, Bulgaria, but etymology filled the binomial with color and motion: ‚Äúinflated,‚Äù ‚Äúblister-like;‚Äù ‚Äúdirtying,‚Äù ‚Äúpolluting,‚Äù ‚Äúblackening,‚Äù ‚Äústaining,‚Äù ‚Äúmaking unclean.‚Äù So be it - the dirty, bulging fungi left me feeling renewed. Larry‚Äôs words and our presence as a group in the woods ‚Äì Jula, his Dad, Martin, and son Micha; Dan, Liam, Sean, KieuLy, Larry, and myself ‚Äì amplified a simple message: even on a chilly, steel-grey New England morning, the forest floor holds a cache of little treasures ‚Äì like Hanukkah gelt or Christmas cookies ‚Äì cups, crusts, and jellies, resplendent in a quiet but full-throated way, edging out the inelegant rumble of the MBTA commuter rail trundling by. Arboreal chamber music enjoyed from front-row seats, reminding me of John Cage, amateur mycologist and vanguard creator of aleatory music: ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as an empty space or an empty time. There is always something to see, something to hear. In fact, try as we may to make a silence, we cannot.‚Äù

A quick rundown of notable species seen: a cascade of lumpy polypores ‚Äì Trametes gibbosa; oak-log sections tinted with green wood-staining fungus ‚Äì Chlorociboria sp.; tiny matchstick fungi ‚Äì Phaeocalicium polyporaeum ‚Äì lifting off from the margins of purple-tooth polypores ‚Äì Trichaptum abietinum; and, as if bidding us farewell like tiny munchkins from Oz, a ‚Äúhairy fairy‚Äù ‚Äì Lachnum virgineum; and a troupe of Mycena sp.

On the Horizon

Stay tuned for our next events. Plans are underfoot for a movie night pegged to an ethnographic film.

There is always something to see, something to hear. In fact, try as we may to make a silence, we cannot.‚Äù A quick rundown of notable species seen: a cascade of lumpy polypores ‚Äì Trametes gibbosa ; oak-log sections tinted with green wood-staining fungus ‚Äì Chlorociboria sp. ; tiny matchstick fungi ‚Äì Phaeocalicium polyporaeum ‚Äì lifting off from the margins of purple-tooth polypores ‚Äì Trichaptum abietinum ; and, as if bidding us farewell like tiny munchkins from Oz, a ‚Äúhairy fairy‚Äù ‚Äì Lachnum virgineum ; and a troupe of Mycena sp. items.subject: [CHAMP: News] Reminder: Larry Millman‚Äôs walk @ 11 AM Sunday
items.snippet: Not all fungi head to Florida for the winter! RSVP . Join Larry Millman @ Codman Woods - Lincoln, MA . Sunday @ 11:00 AM. Parking at Donelan's Supermarket - 145 Lincoln Road, Lincoln, MA 01773 . C
items.htmlBody:
Not all fungi head to Florida for the winter! RSVP.

Join Larry Millman @ Codman Woods - Lincoln, MA. Sunday @ 11:00 AM. Parking at Donelan's Supermarket - 145 Lincoln Road, Lincoln, MA 01773.

C.H.A.M.P. Community Hub for Actualizing Mycological Passion

items.snippet: Simply email < comm.hub.myco@gmail.com > anything newsworthy! Include "[CHAMP: News]" in the subject line to automatically post the email on the CHAMP website's news feed. Keep the
items.htmlBody:
Simply email <comm.hub.myco@gmail.com> anything newsworthy! Include "[CHAMP: News]" in the subject line to automatically post the email on the CHAMP website's news feed. Keep the rest of the group up to date with ease!

-Cody
